wikipedia_page.main:
John Ponsonby, 1st Viscount Ponsonby, GCB (1770 – 22 February 1855) was a longtime British diplomat and politician.
John Ponsonby was an exceptionally handsome man - reportedly he was almost lynched as an aristocrat in a Paris street by a revolutionary mob in the 1790s  but saved by the intervention of a mob of women who saved him because he was so pretty.
